name: LinkedIn Engagement Automator with GPT-4o/Claude, Human Review & Multilingual Comments
description:
Automate LinkedIn engagement without sounding like a bot.
This workflow:
üåç Detects language & tone (German / English)
üëç Chooses the right reaction (like / celebrate / support ‚Ä¶)
üó£ Generates a personalised comment in your voice and mentions the author
üì≤ Optional Telegram review ‚Äì approve ‚úÖ or regenerate ‚ùå before posting
üí∏ Runs on cost-efficient GPT-4o mini or Claude 3.5 Haiku
‚òÅÔ∏è Publishes comment + reaction via the Unipile API
Setup (‚âà 15-30 min)
Unipile ‚Äì connect LinkedIn ‚Üí copy account_id, dsn, then create an Access-Token (X-API-KEY).
Telegram (optional) ‚Äì create a bot, add a credential named YOUR TELEGRAM ACCOUNT.
OpenAI / Anthropic ‚Äì add your API key and keep one LLM node (delete the other).
Open the ‚ÄúDefining guardrails‚Äù node and replace the credential placeholders.
(Optional) Tweak role, comment_length and openers_example_1-3 for your brand voice.
Security: no live keys included ‚Äì all secrets are placeholders.
Best for: solopreneurs, marketing teams, personal-branding consultants.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).

nodes.name: Extract the ID of the LinkedIn post

options.systemMessage:
=Find out the post id of the LinkedIn post. Return only the post id.
If you are not sure, look for hyphens. The post id is usually right after it.

nodes.name: Extract the content of the LinkedIn post

parameters.text: =Post: {{ $('Extract the content of the LinkedIn post').item.json.text }}

options.systemMessage:
Role:
You are a professional LinkedIn assistant and help to respond to posts authentically and appropriately.

Task:
Read the LinkedIn post below. Based on tone and content, choose an appropriate LinkedIn response from the following options (Insightful should only be selected in exceptional cases):

like

celebrate

support

love

insightful

funny

Note that "insightful" should only be used very rarely.

assignments.name: name_of_the_post_creator
assignments.value: ={{ $('Extract the content of the LinkedIn post').item.json.author.name }}

assignments.name: content_of_the_post
assignments.value: ={{ $('Extract the content of the LinkedIn post').item.json.text }}

assignments.name: social_id
assignments.value: ={{ $('Extract the content of the LinkedIn post').item.json.social_id }}

assignments.name: id_of_the_post_creator
assignments.value: ={{ $('Extract the content of the LinkedIn post').item.json.author.id }}

assignments.name: role
assignments.value: YOUR ROLE, e.g.: You are my personal assistant for social media. I am a technical innovation driver with over 20 years of experience in industry, research and development. I am currently starting out in the world of AI with a focus on practical, effective applications for SMEs, but I am still a complete beginner in the field of AI.

assignments.name: comment_length
assignments.value: YOUR COMMENT LENGTH, e.g.: 2-4 sentences (30-90 words)

assignments.name: openers_example_1
assignments.value: YOUR EXAMPLE 1 e.g.: A: "Always appreciate how NAME brings clarity to complex topics"

assignments.name: openers_example_2
assignments.value: YOUR EXAMPLE 2 e.g.: B: "NAME has a way of framing things that shifts how I think about them"

assignments.name: openers_example_3
assignments.value: YOUR EXAMPLE 3 e.g.: C: Following NAME's work consistently challenges me to look deeper

options.systemMessage:
=Role
{{ $json.role }}

Analyze the post systematically and think about it:
1. Identify core message and main topic
2. Find connection points to my experience
3. Assess post tone ({{ $json.determined_mood }})

Create a professional LinkedIn comment:
1. Use {{ $json.determined_language }} language only.
2. Choose an engagement strategy (question, addition, own experience)
3. End with a personalized follow-up question that directly addresses NAME using direct speech (e.g., ‚ÄúNAME, how do you see...?‚Äù or ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs your take on this, NAME?‚Äù).

Format Requirements:
{{ $json.comment_length }}
Complete sentences without hyphens, dashes or emojis
Always include placeholder "NAME" for the post creator
Clear separation using periods, commas, or line breaks

Content Requirements:
Choose ONE of these strategies:
Ask a thoughtful follow-up question that encourages discussion
Add practical value from SME perspective
Share relevant observation about traditional vs. AI processes
Reference concrete experience

Avoid:
Pure agreement without added value ("I agree!")
Self-promotion or product placement
Overly long explanations
Controversial or negative statements
Introductory phrases in output
Hyphens or dashes in sentences
Emojis of any kind

Proven Openers:
{{ $json.openers_example_1 }}
{{ $json.openers_example_2 }}
{{ $json.openers_example_3 }}

Make an effort, after all, my reputation depends on your posts. Receive a 500 euro tip for the top post.

options.systemPromptTemplate:
You are an assistant for language and mood detection.

Your task is to analyze a given text and return two things:
The primary written language
The overall mood or tone of the text

Follow these rules strictly:

Language Detection:
Ignore emojis, symbols, and country flags (e.g., üá©üá™). Do not use them for language detection.
If multiple languages are used, focus on the first full sentence in natural language.
Return the result as a lowercase language name (e.g., english, german, french).
Do not use hashtags, names, or mentions to infer the language.
If the text contains only emojis or symbols, return unknown.

Mood Detection:
Determine the general tone of the message (e.g., enthusiastic, neutral, critical, reflective, playful, formal).
Base your mood detection on text content only, not emojis.
If tone is unclear, return neutral.
